Class ClientSend

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientSend

  • public abstract class ClientSend
extends java.lang.Object
    ClientSend contains methods that sends messages to the server, corresponding to user operations.

    Sends packets to server correspond to user operations including:

    • Delete Account
    • Send Message
    • Check Inbox
    • List Users
    • End Session

      ClientSend()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientSend

        public ClientSend()

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        public static void createAccount(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to create an account. Asks user for an account name to create a new account and checks if it's valid. Account name must be unique and at least one character. Sends a packet containing the username to the server. If successful, account will be created on the server end.

      • logIn

        public static void logIn(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to log in. Asks user for an account name for logging in and checks if it's valid. Account name is valid if the account exists under that name, and if that account is not currently logged in elsewhere. Sends a packet containing the username to the server.

      • listAllAccounts

        public static void listAllAccounts(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to list all accounts, or a subset of them. Asks user to input either 'all' to see all users stored on the server, or to input a Java regular expression to pattern match usernames, and only display those. Sends a packet to the server containing the regular expression (regex) so that the server can put together the appropriate list.

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to send message. Asks user for to input a recipient username and the message the user would like to send to the recipient. Sends a packet to the server containing the recipient name, message, and sender name.

      • pullAllMessages

        public static void pullAllMessages(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to pull all messages. Client request to the server to pull all messages, or view inbox and all current messages. Sends a packet to the server containing the client username, so that the server can grab all the messages stored under that user.

      • deleteAccount

        public static void deleteAccount(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to delete account. Checks if the user has unread messages; if so, asks for confirmation that the user would like to delete the account. If user has no unread messages or confirms deletion, account will successfully be deleted from the server and the session will end. Otherwise, the session resumes and the account is not deleted. Sends a message to the server either containing the client username to be deleted, or an empty string if the account shouldn't be deleted.

      • endSession

        public static void endSession(java.net.Socket socket)
        Request to end the current user session. Sends a packet to the server to close socket.

      • heartbeat

        public static void heartbeat(java.net.Socket socket)
        Sends a heartbeat to the server, in order for the server and client to ensure they are both connected to each other. If the heartbeat is not returned, the session will end.
